Comments_List: Basic Japanese conversational skills, how to read and write hiragana, katakana and some kanji, and grammatical structures.
I developed an ability to speak, write, and interpret a great deal of Japanese. I now would feel confident living in Japan since I know that I can navigate around without much trouble.
Writing, speaking, reading, listening skills in Japanese for daily life and formal situations.
Strengths include great professors, a regimented class/homework/grading routine, and fun lesson plans. Weaknesses include fast pace and strict policies.
The strengths of the class include the extremely engaged and energetic instructors! I enjoyed going to class to learn more Japanese!

The workload was too much which prevented me to spare time for my other courses. We had assignments from different resources to complete, it took me a while to figure out where they are and how I can use them.
YES! one of my favorite classes i've ever taken
Yes, as long as they are committed and are willing to put in the effort, they will learn a lot about the language.
I would definitely recommend this to any student interested in learning a foreign language!
